proof (prove)

    \<Longrightarrow> p q \<equiv> r s
proof -

proof (state)
goal (1 subgoal):
 1. \<lbrakk>a b \<equiv> p q; a b \<equiv> r s\<rbrakk>
    \<Longrightarrow> p q \<equiv> r s
assume "a b \<congruent> p q" and "a b \<congruent> r s"

proof (state)
this:
  a b \<equiv> p q
  a b \<equiv> r s

goal (1 subgoal):
 1. \<lbrakk>a b \<equiv> p q; a b \<equiv> r s\<rbrakk>
    \<Longrightarrow> p q \<equiv> r s
with A2

proof (chain)
picking this:
  \<forall>a b p q r s.
     a b \<equiv> p q \<and> a b \<equiv> r s \<longrightarrow>
     p q \<equiv> r s
  a b \<equiv> p q
  a b \<equiv> r s
show ?thesis

proof (prove)
using this:
  \<forall>a b p q r s.
     a b \<equiv> p q \<and> a b \<equiv> r s \<longrightarrow>
     p q \<equiv> r s
  a b \<equiv> p q

goal (1 subgoal):

by blast

proof (state)
this:
  p q \<equiv> r s

goal:
No subgoals!
qed

definition is_segment :: "'p set \<Rightarrow> bool" where
  "is_segment X \<equiv> \<exists>x y. X = {x, y}"

definition segments :: "'p set set" where
  "segments = {X. is_segment X}"

definition SC :: "'p set \<Rightarrow> 'p set \<Rightarrow> bool" where
  "SC X Y \<equiv> \<exists>w x y z. X = {w, x} \<and> Y = {y, z} \<and> w x \<congruent> y z"

definition SC_rel :: "('p set \<times> 'p set) set" where
  "SC_rel = {(X, Y) | X Y. SC X Y}"

lemma left_segment_congruence:
    assumes "{a, b} = {p, q}" and "p q \<congruent> c d"
    shows "a b \<congruent> c d"

proof (prove)
goal (1 subgoal):
 1. a b \<equiv> c d
proof cases

proof (state)
goal (2 subgoals):
 1. ?P \<Longrightarrow> a b \<equiv> c d
 2. \<not> ?P \<Longrightarrow> a b \<equiv> c d
assume "a = p"

proof (state)
this:
  a = p

goal (2 subgoals):
 1. ?P \<Longrightarrow> a b \<equiv> c d
 2. \<not> ?P \<Longrightarrow> a b \<equiv> c d
with unordered_pair_element_equality [of a b p q] and \<open>{a, b} = {p, q}\<close>

proof (chain)
picking this:
  \<lbrakk>{a, b} = {p, q}; a = p\<rbrakk> \<Longrightarrow> b = q
  {a, b} = {p, q}
  a = p
have "b = q"

proof (prove)
using this:
  \<lbrakk>{a, b} = {p, q}; a = p\<rbrakk> \<Longrightarrow> b = q
  {a, b} = {p, q}
  a = p

goal (1 subgoal):

by simp

proof (state)
this:
  b = q

goal (2 subgoals):

proof (chain)
picking this:
  p q \<equiv> c d
  a = p
  b = q
show ?thesis

proof (prove)
using this:
  p q \<equiv> c d
  a = p
  b = q

goal (1 subgoal):
 1. a b \<equiv> c d
by simp

proof (state)
this:
  a b \<equiv> c d

goal (1 subgoal):

lemma C_SC_equiv: "a b \<congruent> c d = SC {a, b} {c, d}"
proof

proof (state)
goal (2 subgoals):
 1. a b \<equiv> c d \<Longrightarrow> SC {a, b} {c, d}
 2. SC {a, b} {c, d} \<Longrightarrow> a b \<equiv> c d
assume "a b \<congruent> c d"

proof (state)
this:
  a b \<equiv> c d

goal (2 subgoals):
 1. a b \<equiv> c d \<Longrightarrow> SC {a, b} {c, d}
 2. SC {a, b} {c, d} \<Longrightarrow> a b \<equiv> c d
with SC_def [of "{a, b}" "{c, d}"]

proof (chain)
picking this:
  SC {a, b} {c, d} \<equiv>
  \<exists>w x y z.
     {a, b} = {w, x} \<and> {c, d} = {y, z} \<and> w x \<equiv> y z
  a b \<equiv> c d
show "SC {a, b} {c, d}"

proof (prove)
using this:
  SC {a, b} {c, d} \<equiv>
  \<exists>w x y z.
     {a, b} = {w, x} \<and> {c, d} = {y, z} \<and> w x \<equiv> y z
  a b \<equiv> c d

goal (1 subgoal):
 1. SC {a, b} {c, d}
by auto

proof (state)
this:
  SC {a, b} {c, d}

goal (1 subgoal):
 1. SC {a, b} {c, d} \<Longrightarrow> a b \<equiv> c d
next

proof (state)
goal (1 subgoal):
 1. SC {a, b} {c, d} \<Longrightarrow> a b \<equiv> c d
assume "SC {a, b} {c, d}"

proof (state)
this:
  SC {a, b} {c, d}

goal (1 subgoal):
 1. SC {a, b} {c, d} \<Longrightarrow> a b \<equiv> c d
with SC_def [of "{a, b}" "{c, d}"]

proof (chain)
picking this:
  SC {a, b} {c, d} \<equiv>
  \<exists>w x y z.
     {a, b} = {w, x} \<and> {c, d} = {y, z} \<and> w x \<equiv> y z
  SC {a, b} {c, d}
obtain w x y z where "{a, b} = {w, x}" and "{c, d} = {y, z}" and "w x \<congruent> y z"

proof (prove)
using this:
  SC {a, b} {c, d} \<equiv>
  \<exists>w x y z.
     {a, b} = {w, x} \<and> {c, d} = {y, z} \<and> w x \<equiv> y z
  SC {a, b} {c, d}

goal (1 subgoal):
 1. (\<And>w x y z.
        \<lbrakk>{a, b} = {w, x}; {c, d} = {y, z}; w x \<equiv> y z\<rbrakk>
        \<Longrightarrow> thesis) \<Longrightarrow>
    thesis
by blast

proof (state)
this:
  {a, b} = {w, x}
  {c, d} = {y, z}
  w x \<equiv> y z

goal (1 subgoal):
 1. SC {a, b} {c, d} \<Longrightarrow> a b \<equiv> c d

from left_segment_congruence [of a b w x y z] and
        \<open>{a, b} = {w, x}\<close> and
        \<open>w x \<congruent> y z\<close>

proof (chain)
picking this:
  \<lbrakk>{a, b} = {w, x}; w x \<equiv> y z\<rbrakk>
  \<Longrightarrow> a b \<equiv> y z
  {a, b} = {w, x}
  w x \<equiv> y z
have "a b \<congruent> y z"

proof (prove)
using this:
  \<lbrakk>{a, b} = {w, x}; w x \<equiv> y z\<rbrakk>
  \<Longrightarrow> a b \<equiv> y z
  {a, b} = {w, x}
  w x \<equiv> y z

goal (1 subgoal):
 1. a b \<equiv> y z
by simp

proof (state)
this:
  a b \<equiv> y z

goal (1 subgoal):
 1. SC {a, b} {c, d} \<Longrightarrow> a b \<equiv> c d
with right_segment_congruence [of c d y z a b] and \<open>{c, d} = {y, z}\<close>

proof (chain)
picking this:
  \<lbrakk>{c, d} = {y, z}; a b \<equiv> y z\<rbrakk>
  \<Longrightarrow> a b \<equiv> c d
  {c, d} = {y, z}
  a b \<equiv> y z
show "a b \<congruent> c d"

proof (prove)
using this:
  \<lbrakk>{c, d} = {y, z}; a b \<equiv> y z\<rbrakk>
  \<Longrightarrow> a b \<equiv> c d
  {c, d} = {y, z}
  a b \<equiv> y z

goal (1 subgoal):
 1. a b \<equiv> c d
by simp

proof (state)
this:
  a b \<equiv> c d

proof (prove)
goal (1 subgoal):
 1. B a b c
proof -

proof (state)
goal (1 subgoal):

from \<open>B a b d\<close> and \<open>B b c d\<close> and A7' [of a b d b c]

picking this:
  B a b d
  B b c d
  \<lbrakk>B a b d; B b c d\<rbrakk>
  \<Longrightarrow> \<exists>x. B b x b \<and> B c x a

using this:

  B b c d

goal (1 subgoal):

        \<lbrakk>B b x b; B c x a\<rbrakk>
        \<Longrightarrow> thesis) \<Longrightarrow>
    thesis
by auto

proof (state)
this:
  B b x b
  B c x a

goal (1 subgoal):
 1. B a b c
from \<open>B b x b\<close>

proof (chain)
picking this:
  B b x b
have "b = x"

proof (prove)
using this:
  B b x b

goal (1 subgoal):

by (rule A6')

this:
  b = x

goal (1 subgoal):
 1. B a b c
with \<open>B c x a\<close>

picking this:
  B c x a

using this:
  B c x a
  b = x

goal (1 subgoal):

by simp

this:
  B c b a

goal (1 subgoal):
 1. B a b c
thus "B a b c"

proof (prove)
using this:
  B c b a

goal (1 subgoal):

this:

No subgoals!

theorem th3_7_1:
    assumes "b \<noteq> c" and "B a b c" and "B b c d"
    shows "B a c d"

proof (prove)
goal (1 subgoal):
 1. B a c d
proof -

proof (state)
goal (1 subgoal):
 1. B a c d
from A4'

proof (chain)
picking this:
  \<exists>x. B ?q ?a x \<and> ?a x \<equiv> ?b ?c
obtain x where "B a c x" and "c x \<congruent> c d"

proof (prove)
using this:
  \<exists>x. B ?q ?a x \<and> ?a x \<equiv> ?b ?c

goal (1 subgoal):
 1. (\<And>x.
        \<lbrakk>B a c x; c x \<equiv> c d\<rbrakk>
        \<Longrightarrow> thesis) \<Longrightarrow>
    thesis
by fast

proof (state)
this:
  B a c x
  c x \<equiv> c d

goal (1 subgoal):
 1. B a c d
from \<open>B a b c\<close> and \<open>B a c x\<close>

proof (chain)
picking this:
  B a b c
  B a c x
have "B b c x"

proof (prove)
using this:
  B a b c
  B a c x

goal (1 subgoal):
 1. B b c x
by (rule th3_6_1)

proof (state)
this:
  B b c x

goal (1 subgoal):
 1. B a c d
have "c d \<congruent> c d"

proof (prove)
goal (1 subgoal):
 1. c d \<equiv> c d
by (rule th2_1)

proof (state)
this:
  c d \<equiv> c d

goal (1 subgoal):

with \<open>b \<noteq> c\<close> and \<open>B b c x\<close> and \<open>c x \<congruent> c d\<close> and \<open>B b c d\<close>

picking this:
  b \<noteq> c

  B b c d
  c d \<equiv> c d
have "x = d"

using this:
  b \<noteq> c

  c x \<equiv> c d
  B b c d
  c d \<equiv> c d

by (rule A4_unique)

this:
  x = d

with \<open>B a c x\<close>

proof (prove)
using this:
  B a c x

goal (1 subgoal):
 1. B a c d
by simp

proof (state)
this:
  B a c d

No subgoals!

subsection "Simple theorems about congruence and betweenness"

definition (in tarski_first5) Col :: "'p \<Rightarrow> 'p \<Rightarrow> 'p \<Rightarrow> bool" where
  "Col a b c \<equiv> B a b c \<or> B b c a \<or> B c a b"
end
